```{=html} ```
## Exercises 1. Square a number. You're tired of writing `x^2` when you want to square `x`, so you want a function to square a number. You can call it `square()`. I showed this in the slides, now try on your own! ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # start out with a number to test x <- 3 # you'll want your function to return this number x^2 square <- function() { } # test it out square(x) square(53) 53^2 # does this match? ``` ::: ## Resources - [Advanced R](https://adv-r.hadley.nz/functions.html)
